title: Can we bring text inside an image in HTML? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes you can. First create a container and nest image and paragraph inside it . And then CSS would img{ position : relative; } p{ position:absolute; left:50%; transform:translate(-50%,-50%); } Text is center aligned vertically and horizontally both. You can also set the background image for div and make it relative positioning.

Yes it is possible! Step1: Create a ‘parent’ div with any position: (relative, fixed, absolute) Step2: Create an image in that div and give it a width of 100% and change its display to ‘block’ Step3: Now create a div; with your text; with position: absolute; top:0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; z-index: 1; inside the ‘parent’ div Done! Note: Your text should be lesser than the image size or else your text ‘overflows’ outside the parent container. Parent div width and image width should be the same

Yes, you can by either two way as Setting text over image - wrap the image and text inside div and set its position property relative. Then change the position property of text tag -> set position property absoluteRender the text on image using canvasThe first one is easy way to do this.
